result.execSummary:
The defendant William A Ayala-Pagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PROBATION REVIEW HEARING 11/6/2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 40.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Court found domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due an dowing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Pay all  supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Due to financial hardship, Court waived the fine and DNA fees associated with this case.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No violent contact with anyone in the world.
May have no violent contact with the victim.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and a parenting class.
Establish paternity for all of his children.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William A Ayala-Pagen in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.   
Defendant sentenced to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served. Court ordered huber privileges for work, child care, and any treatment the defendant participates in.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling AND a parenting class.
-Establish paternity for all of his children.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with anyone in the world.
-Defendant may have no violent contact with the victim.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived the fine and DNA fees associated with this case.
Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant William A Ayala-Pagen in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant William A Ayala-Pagen in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives Spanish Interpreter for purposes of today's hearing.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.  Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated August 3, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant William A Ayala-Pagen in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Giselle CS and her children and her residence; Dairye V.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant William A Ayala-Pagen in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  
Defendant William A Ayala-Pagen in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter sworn: Dawn Maldonado  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
